intro: Cirrhopetalum albociliatum, commonly known as the white-fringed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often adorned with delicate white cilia, giving it its scientific name. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
